dismissalText.commentary: Gautam Gambhir b Syed Rasel 101 (113b 11x4 0x6 153m) SR: 89.38

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'em! Fullish outside off stump, and a tired Gambhir heaves across the line only to get a bottom-edge back onto off stump, thats the shot of a weary man but a good hundred...he hobbles off the field to some decent applause from his team-mates

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rafique player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: MS Dhoni player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edged and gone! Rafique fires it full and wide, Dhoni makes room and cuts, getting low as sees the ball staying down too, and the under-edge is snapped up brilliantly by Rahim! Dhoni doesnt even wait for the umpire's signal, just shuts up shop and makes for the pavilion

headshotImage.caption: Yuvraj Singh headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuvraj Singh headshot

dismissalComment.html: taken! Softest of soft dismissals! Tossed up, good rotation, and what does he do? He plays out in front of his pad, closing the bat face awkwardly, and presents Rafique with the easiest of caught-and-bowled chances, and I mean easy - just popped back to his palms. Yuvraj stands there, shakes his head, and ambles off while Rafique gleefully savours the wicket

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: tossed up on middle and leg stump, the ball spins down as Karthik shuffles across and forward and plays with the turn, playing all over it, Rafique appeals...and thats a very surprising decision given that he was so far down the track, and that the ball bounced a bit too...ah well, thats the game of cricket for you

headshotImage.caption: Syed Rasel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Syed Rasel player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: this time he's gone! Sehwag plays the same shot three balls out of four, connecting well on the first, feebly on the second, and making a total hash of the third! Rasel sticks to the same line, pitching it full, asking him to hit it, and all Sehwag does is slog it straight up in the air for mid-off to run across and take a diving catch, tumbling over after completing the catch and getting mobbed by his team-mates

commentTextItems.html: tossed up, he goes down and slogs it out to deep midwicket to end the game, India victors by 46 runs and taking the series

commentPostTextItems.html: India won the toss, and were boosted by Gautam Gambhir's second ODI hundred. No other batsmen crossed 50 - Rahul Dravid's unbeaten 42 was the next best - but it was more than enough to take an unassailable 2-0 series lead. Bangladesh never looked in the hunt, losing wickets at regular intervals. Aftab Ahmed flashed around for a brisk 40, but the way Habibul Bashar plodded around for an 88-ball 43, you could see the attitude of this side. Mashrafe Mortaza decided to have some fun, slamming Dinesh Mongia for four consecutive sixes in his 42 from 22 balls, but India coasted to a 46-run victory.
A series win that will undoubtedly do India some good given all the mess thats surrounded them in recent time.
Thats all we have for you now. Do join us for the final game, from Chittagong, on May 15. Hope you've enjoyed the coverage. This is Jamie Alter, on behalf of Manish Jha too, signing off. Cheers!

commentTextItems.html: tossed up, he uses the feet and flicks out to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump, pokes at it and gets an inside-edge
tossed up on middle and leg, worked to square leg
fired down the pads, worked away for one

commentPreTextItems.html: Final over coming up. 51 to get. Oh boy.

commentTextItems.html: tossed up, comes on with the arm, beats him
comes out, Yuvraj fires it wide and Dhoni collects, wide is the call

commentTextItems.html: quicker, flatter, pulled into the midwicket region
tossed up outside off stump, defended to cover

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Sehwag b Yuvraj Singh 42 (22b 1x4 5x6 40m) SR: 190.9

commentTextItems.html: all over, as Mortaza stands and picks a length delivery up and into Sehwag's hands at mid-on. 42 from 22! Take a bow.
quick, flat down leg stump and he coolly clips it out to short fine leg for one

commentTextItems.html: Dan van Bunge, where are you?? Mortaza's giving Mongia some stick! Plants the leg out and slams this one straight back over long-off's head for six more! Carnage!
now thats HUGE! Mortaza's having fun here! Stand and deliver! Picks it from where it lands and hammers it over wide long-on for six more!
bigger, better! Stands and clips one off the pads rows back over midwicket, crowd loves it
biggie! Dances down, even with the hamstring issues, and clouts it over mid-on for six
tossed up on off stump, worked to square leg
quicker one outside off stump, he swings the bat at it and misses

dismissalText.long: c Javed Omar b Syed Rasel
dismissalText.commentary: Virender Sehwag c Javed Omar b Syed Rasel 21 (26b 1x4 1x6 34m) SR: 80.76

dismissalComment.html: this time he's gone! Sehwag plays the same shot three balls out of four, connecting well on the first, feebly on the second, and making a total hash of the third! Rasel sticks to the same line, pitching it full, asking him to hit it, and all Sehwag does is slog it straight up in the air for mid-off to run across and take a diving catch, tumbling over after completing the catch and getting mobbed by his team-mates

dismissalText.commentary: Yuvraj Singh c & b Mohammad Rafique 24 (22b 2x4 2x6 21m) SR: 109.09

dismissalComment.html: taken! Softest of soft dismissals! Tossed up, good rotation, and what does he do? He plays out in front of his pad, closing the bat face awkwardly, and presents Rafique with the easiest of caught-and-bowled chances, and I mean easy - just popped back to his palms. Yuvraj stands there, shakes his head, and ambles off while Rafique gleefully savours the wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Chawla/Dhoni) 7 (12b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: low full toss, driven to mid-off, calls for one, then some no-no-wait business, Omar's confused and sends him back, but even a despairing dive cant save Tamim from Chawla's excellent throw to Dhoni and he's livid with his partner, looking back and shouting at him, cursing, and even Omar doesnt hold back with his response...veteran and rookie having a little spat there, as all await the third umpire's decision, but that was clearly out

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Chawla/Dhoni) 7 (12b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: low full toss, driven to mid-off, calls for one, then some no-no-wait business, Omar's confused and sends him back, but even a despairing dive cant save Tamim from Chawla's excellent throw to Dhoni and he's livid with his partner, looking back and shouting at him, cursing, and even Omar doesnt hold back with his response...veteran and rookie having a little spat there, as all await the third umpire's decision, but that was clearly out

stories.title: Bangladesh v India, 2007

stories.summary: Wisden's match report for the second ODI between Bangladesh and India, 2007

stories.title: Bangladesh still novices at chasing
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: The woes of Bangladesh batting veer from the promising Aftab Ahmed bent on giving his wicket away to Javed Omar and Habibul Bashar whose over-cautious approach often puts the brakes on the run chase

stories.title: Gambhir ton spells dilemma for selectors
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Gautam Gambhir's century against Bangladesh gives him an edge over the other two openers - Sehwag and Uthappa - in sealing a more permanent spot for himself at the top

stories.title: Minimising the dot balls
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v India, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Bangladesh scored 116 runs in boundaries to India's 114, but they played out 38 more dot balls

stories.summary:
Gautam Gambhir's second one-day century, and a promising three-wicket
debut for Piyush Chawla were the highlights as India sealed the one-day
series against Bangladesh with a comprehensive 46-run victory in a match
